required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Point of Care Ultrasound Lung Artificial Intelligence (AI) Validation Data Collection Study
clinical_study.official_title: Point of Care Ultrasound Lung Artificial Intelligence (AI) Validation Data Collection Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to collect image data and relevant clinical data from medical records of patients with suspicion of lung consolidation or pleural effusion. The information will be used to test the performance of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in identification of features associated with the above lung conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, observational, multi-center, post-market clinical study. Enrollment will continue (up to a maximum of 300 subjects) until diagnostic LUS exams are acquired for each of the following groups:
- Pleural effusion positive: 75 patients confirmed as positive for pleural effusion
- Lung consolidation positive: 75 patients confirmed as positive for lung consolidation
- Disease negative: 150 patients confirmed as negative for both of the above conditions Subjects are not required to return to the clinical site for follow-up evaluations. Accrual of subjects is anticipated to be completed in approximately 12 months. Adult subjects with suspicion of pleural effusion or lung consolidation will be enrolled in the study. In addition, pediatric subjects with suspicion of lung consolidation (with weight of at least 10 kg) will be enrolled and may comprise up to one-third of the lung consolidation group (i.e., 25 positive and 25 negative cases).s.

primary_outcome.measure: The study data will be used to support future performance assessments for Artificial Intelligence based algorithms as described by FDA guidance for Computer Assisted Detection and Diagnostic Devices

arm_group.description: Adult and pediatric subjects with suspicion of pleural effusion
Adult and pediatric subjects with suspicion of lung consolidation

intervention.description: Ultrasound scan of subjects in up to 14 lung zones

study_pop.textblock: Adult subjects with suspicion of pleural effusion or lung consolidation will be enrolled in the study. In addition, pediatric subjects with suspicion of lung consolidation (with weight of at least 10 kg) will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects presenting to the Emergency Department, admitted to the hospital, or seen in the outpatient setting with suspicion of pleural effusion or lung consolidation who received chest imaging to include chest X-ray or CT, or for whom chest X-ray or CT are planned. Suspicion of pleural effusion or lung consolidation may be based upon imaging findings or presentation of symptoms including (but not limited to) dyspnea, hypoxia, tachypnea, rales, or dullness.
2. Adult subjects must be able to be to undergo scanning at least 10/14 lung zones, including including all anterior (1-4) and lateral zones (5-8), and the lowermost posterior zones (11 and 14). Pediatric subjects must be able to undergo scanning in at least 8 lung zones, including all anterior zones (1-4), and the lowermost anterior and posterior zones (6, 8, 10, and 12); see Section 8.1.3 Lung Ultrasound Exams.
3. Subject is willing to provide informed consent (or assent where age appropriate) to participate in the study. Subjects under 18 years of age require informed consent of a parent or guardian and assent as required by institutional IRB.
4. Weight of subject is greater than or equal to 10 kg.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has pathology precluding safe and pain-free ultrasound probe placement such as burn, significant soft tissue injury or surgical incisions.
2. Current imprisonment.
3. Prior pleurodesis procedure.
4. Known history of advanced interstitial lung disease (DLCO <50% predicted)
5. Known severe ARDS (per Berlin Oxygenation Criteria8: PaO2/FiO2 < 100)
6. Known history of advanced Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Syndrome (COPD; GOLD9 Stage 4 for airflow limitation severity defined as FEV1 < 30% of predicted)
7. Known severe restrictive lung disease with baseline FVC < 50% or TLCpleth <50% predicted
8. Presence of subcutaneous air that precludes imaging
9. Body Mass Index (BMI) > 40
10. Significant scoliosis (Cobb angle â‰¥ 20 degrees).
11. Pediatric subjects with chronic lung diseases other than asthma.
12. Pediatric subjects on chronic respiratory support (i.e., nasal canula, CPAP, BiPAP, or tracheostomy).
